website_summaries.verdict: An easy to use solar panel with fairly reliable power output to charge devices and small battery packs.
pros: Great solar charging output for its 20W size
Storage pocket in panel case is very handy to hold devices while they’re charging, users note
cons: Longer charging cables don’t work as well with this solar panel
Panel may need to be reset if sunlight conditions change
Charging rate can be variable even in full sun

customer_reviews.title: Goal Zero products are tops
customer_reviews.text: Excellent panel, it restores my power pack just like it claims it will. Goal Zero products are tops. I took a torch 250 on a three month bicycle tour last year and it did a excellent job so i knew I could trust the manufacturer. When I need other solar products Goal Zero is who I'll turn too. The Solar Panel stopped working after one use and I have not gotten any help from customer service. I still like the other products but this one and customer service would get ZERO STARS.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Akridge

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Perfect panel for any outdoorsman or Goal Zero yeti owner. Purchased the Nomad 7 a few weeks ago and had to pick up a bigger panel to charge my Yeti 150. Generic cheaper panels don't do the work as this panel does. Price was less than MSRP so I had to jump on it. Nice storage zipper on the rear of the panel case to store a portable battery pack, flash light (like the switch 10 with flashlight attachment) and can charge while on the go. (open panel, attach the carabineer clips to a backpack and charge accessories while hiking, biking or camping)
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with Portable Power!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great portable solar panel. I do a water aerobics class on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, and am able to top off my cell phone, my vaporizer, and my kindle, while I'm enjoying the pool. I just set it up angled to the sun and let it do the work. I can hook it up to the Yeti 400, but it really needs a bigger solar panel to do that. It would take days to charge the Yeti all by itself. This small one is perfect for charging those small items that you use every day.
customer_reviews.author: Deb KayeTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: When I was shopping for solar chargers to use during Peace Corps service, I chose the Nomad 20 because it got fairly good reviews. What a mistake. I wish the I had returned it for a full refund when I still had a chance. I've had nothing but problems from day one. I lived in sunny Florida at the time of purchase but it wouldn't charge no matter where I located it. I tried on top of my car, flat on the ground, upright, on the roof of my house...It took days to charge, if at all, even in the direct sun. If it wouldn't charge in Florida, it probably won't charge anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Dot B

customer_reviews.title: Great to add additional energy to your battery!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a 5 day camping trip paired with the Yeti400. I kept my Mavic Pro drone, Panasonic GH5 and laptop powered up over the whole trip with this to add more energy to the battery. Note that it doesn't charge very fast so the panel needed to stay in the sun the whole day to get 1/4 of the power back. After another 2 days I wouldn't have been able to keep all those devices fully charged at the level I was using them at.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Christianson

customer_reviews.title: I love these panels
customer_reviews.text: I love these panels. They charge my Sherpa 100 very nicely. I had a set of these that I bought with the Sherpa at Costco and wanted a second set (taking me up to 40W). I know there is a lot of discussion about "is it worth the price" and that is something I'm trying to figure out. I've not purchased other panels yet but with 40W I can charge my Sherpa in about 4 hours of "good" sun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Especially good in combination with a Yeti 150
customer_reviews.text: works great with the Yeti 150 power pack. Not quite as great, but still good, for direct charging without going through the Yeti. Some items that charge fine through the Yeti won't charge up directly from the Nomad. The car-charger adapter on the Nomad seems especially finicky -- I have yet to get anything to charge from that, even items that charge fine in the car.
customer_reviews.author: TX-WY Snowbird

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful enough for real use.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed by how slowly this charged my Goal Zero 150. I left it in direct sunlight for a whole day and it only charged the battery to 20%; I plugged in an Anker 22500 portable battery to charge and it wouldn't charge at all.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Canadian

customer_reviews.title: ... the 7w panel with a little battery charger - nice units, but I needed more power to charge ...
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought the 7w panel with a little battery charger - nice units, but I needed more power to charge my and several friends cell phones during a 2 week vacation where we were camping without access to electricity, but did have cell signals. This charged my Yeti 150 beautifully - I could use the yeti to charge 2 phones at a time on the yeti while this panel kept it topped off.
customer_reviews.author: DigitalSorceress

customer_reviews.title: I've been having problems with my Goal Zero solar pannels ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been having problems with my Goal Zero solar pannels. This Nomad 20 (made in China) only charges up my Sherpa 50 3/4 of the way and will only charge my Sherpa 100 two bars. I had to buy a Solar pannel product from Power Film Solar (made in the USA) in order to get a full charge in both power units.
customer_reviews.author: P. S.

customer_reviews.title: First, I'm a huge Fan of the Goal Zero Stuff.
customer_reviews.text: First, I'm a huge Fan of the Goal Zero Stuff. I have several items all works as they should. GZ stuff is expensive, which is why I'm giving 4 stars on this purchase. Based on experience, I'll assume the GZ quality control is good, but with this item, I guess during shipping, the controller broke off (detached) from the back of the panel and was just hanging by the wires. Even like that, the panel did work just fine, but thanks to Amazon's great return policy, they easily took it back.
customer_reviews.author: dfrjr

customer_reviews.title: A fourth Nomad 20 solar panel or higher is the quantity that makes the difference!
customer_reviews.text: As three panels charging a yeti 400 wasn't enough in this cloudy san francisco weather, a fourth panel really makes a difference. If you live where the weather isn't always the sunniest, four nomad 20's or higher up to 8 (depending on how much power you need) will guarantee the best chance at maintaining a full charge capacity. Thank you Goal Zero!
customer_reviews.author: kurt slotkowski

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: We have the 7 watt one, but the new 20 watt charges much faster even on cloudy days. Don't hesitate on buying this one for your camping needs.
customer_reviews.author: Rick L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for day/weekend camping
customer_reviews.text: I own a few GoalZero products and I got this one to daisy chain to a older model of the Nomad Solar Panel. Connects to all my old accessories and works perfect out the box. Great portable solar solution for the weekend/day camper.
customer_reviews.author: C. Butler

customer_reviews.title: They said fast charge, and they mean it.
customer_reviews.text: I dont know what I was expecting when I purchased this item, but I know I needed something to reliably charge small battery devices. I tested this in my kitchen on some indirect light coming through the window and no inside lighting. It recharged my Nexus 6 from 90% to 100% within 2 minutes or so. Very fast charging with that minimal lighting! This is definitely going in my emergency disaster pack.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with multiple connections built in
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. Easy to use with multiple connections built in. Did get second panel to boost output to YETI. Do pay attention when using two panels for proper connection. Once I got that corrected...worked very well even in cloudy conditions.
customer_reviews.author: mikefoss

customer_reviews.title: Great panel
customer_reviews.text: Awesome solar panels. Perfect for car camping and being on the road. Very compact and light, and the chord that comes with it to plug into my Yeti 150 is plenty long to put the panels on the roof when I'm parked, and leave the battery someplace inside my bus where it's easy to use. So happy to be able to harness energy from the sun!
customer_reviews.author: Colby Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Good product, BUT ONLY FOR THE FIRST 2 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for the first 2 months, now it's dead. I never exposed it to high heat, or water, or anything else that may cause it to stop working. It's bad enough that my battery almost burned my house down but now my solar panel is worthless, also. Such a disappointing product that I spent so much money on.
customer_reviews.author: geoff ward-kotas

customer_reviews.title: Will charge iPad 2
customer_reviews.text: This really works well and will charge my iPad 2, which was my biggest concern. BUT, thanks to another reviewers tip, you must charge the iPad with the 12V socket and not the provided USB connection. I use the Aukey 48W/9.6A 4 Port USB Car Charger Adapter. I also like the fact that I can keep all my cords and accessories in the zippered pouch on the back.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. The first time I opened it I was inside and had sun coming through the window. I plugged in my phone & instantly started powering up.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Sperry

customer_reviews.title: Extra Power on the go from the Sun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this panel to go along with my Goal Zero 150 Watt Power Station. These panels worked well to keep me charged up doing an event while the power station was in use.
customer_reviews.author: NavyVet1093

customer_reviews.title: Favorite toy for camping
customer_reviews.text: I love using this camping to charge phone, headlamp, etc. it’s fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Biggs

customer_reviews.title: Super product
customer_reviews.text: Product as described, high quality, and arrived timely. Tested it charging AAA, AA, and D batteries with 2 different chargers and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camping Addition
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected; looking forward to using on overland trip to NM, AZ, CO and UT. Use with car charger with charge Tundra battery while running 82qt ARB fridge.
customer_reviews.author: R. Garza

customer_reviews.title: Works well just like all goal zero products
customer_reviews.text: Works well just like all goal zero products. This big bad 20 really pushes some juice too. It will charge your devices at a good rate,yet its still very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product..used it recently during power outage due to hurricane Michael. Worked wonderfully for charging my cell phone and my external battery. Compact and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ajay

customer_reviews.title: The good customer service makes up for it a little bit
customer_reviews.text: after abotu two weeks, the blue light stopped turning on and i can no longer charge via the USB cable. I contacted Goal Zero and they did authorize a replacement to be shipped to me. The good customer service makes up for it a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: aaronhab

customer_reviews.title: I am very excited to see how well this works ...
customer_reviews.text: I am very excited to see how well this works with the GoalZero Venture 70 in an upcoming off grid expedition...I will update afterwards...
customer_reviews.author: tekz

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: i wanted to have a solar panel to recharge my yeti 400, and this one will be great when we generally have 120 degree days.
customer_reviews.author: S.C.

customer_reviews.title: No regrets, very happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this primarily for emergency purposes, but I've used it twice to charge my powerbank and mobile phone. Definitely no regrets with this purchase! I am planning to get some accessories when I've saved up again...really good investment I think. Thanks Amazon for delivering my order so quickly, even a day or two ahead of expected arrival. Happy customer here!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solar panels. Convenient.
customer_reviews.text: For camping works great for your electric gadgets. Good for emergency kits too.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: It does the job little bulky And a little confusing
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little bulky and a little confusing but it does the job
customer_reviews.author: SU

customer_reviews.title: It takes a while (especially because it's winter) but I'm very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: Used it in Illinois in winter to charge my yeti generator. It takes a while (especially because it's winter) but I'm very pleased with it!
customer_reviews.author: K. Liggett

customer_reviews.title: better for topping off
customer_reviews.text: Quality build and works well. A little stretch to use this to for recharging a Yeti 400 if being heavily used...better for topping off.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The only thing I will mention is that it has to have direct sunlight to work. Does not work on an overcast day. I know... it's a "solar" panel, just letting you know.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have purchased. Charges your dead iPhone to 100% In 3-4 hours with full sun, my iPad in 4 hours. Great if your out camping or SHTF.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: charges my electronics fast.
customer_reviews.text: Goalzero nomad 20 is excellent i got it together connected with boulder 30 from goalzero and nomad 13. Both charging up my tablet from samsung 12.2 pro with 2 guide 10 and my wifes samsung pro 10 inch tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Bucio

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sent this and the Yeti 150 to PR for my brother. It really is a life and time saver.
customer_reviews.author: smvgtr

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Solar power generator.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product to charge Sherpa or devices when power supply is not available or unreliable. Easy to use. Good quality construction. We've only tried at home so far. Will update as we gain experience.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Girl

customer_reviews.title: You need this panel
customer_reviews.text: Works WONDERFUL. Charges the battery in hours, but works wonders
customer_reviews.author: Fred T Hirsch

customer_reviews.title: I got this to charge my portable Goal Zero generator ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this to charge my portable Goal Zero generator but it also charges cell phones. Major bonus. It comes with little clips that can facilitate in hanging while charging.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica G.

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Got a battery and in ditect sunlight it would charge from 20 to 100 in less than 4 hours
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Totally Handy!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased with Goal Zero 400. Love it the portability and ease of storage! Cutting costs in electric bills left and right. I am anxious to use it in the spring and summer months on outings.
customer_reviews.author: rmdupl

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cool idea, but it takes a really long time to charge anything
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Weyant

customer_reviews.title: So far I love this solar power panel from Goal Zero
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this solar power panel from Goal Zero. I will be using it to charge my Goal Zero Torch 250 flash light. Please see the attached photos I have taken of the Nomad 20W solar panel. One of the photos shows how you can connect the Goal Zero Torch 250 light (sold separately obviously) to it to recharge it. The Nomad 20 seems very well constructed and has a nice zipper pouch in the back to conceal and hold in the power recharging cables.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: Well-made, light, and easy to move around! We are loving these panels, making use of that strong California sun. Perfect for adventurers who need to have power when they're roaming off the grid
customer_reviews.author: jane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item. Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item. Exactly as described. This really helped me get the job done. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: Mikey O'Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't charge phone didn't retain charge
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to charge my phone but in order to do that I would have to leave my phone in the sun which will not charge when it gets hot so how do I charge my phone?
customer_reviews.author: Brian Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Just tested it out today and it's mostly cloudy yet ...
customer_reviews.text: Just tested it out today and it's mostly cloudy yet it still managed to power up the USB led light stick. Looking forward to using it in direct sun.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G.

customer_reviews.title: Takes long time to charge Goal Zero Yeti 150 Portable ...
customer_reviews.text: Takes long time to charge Goal Zero Yeti 150 Portable Power Station but it is an option when there are not electricity power.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great for mobile devices, slow to recharge Yeti 150
customer_reviews.text: The panel works as advertised, but I think the charging times listed on Goal Zero's site are low. After a full sunny day (12 hours) monitoring and adjusting the panel to best face the sun, my Yeti 150 charged to about 20% and gave my Macbook pro an 80% charge (while turned off) before the yeti was completely drained. If you're buying to charge USB devices directly or to charge a portable battery, there are definitely cheaper options. However, build quality is great and 20W will charge any USB-powered device you own.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Does not wheigh much and does what it is supposed ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not wheigh much and does what it is supposed to ;) I charged my phone with it, no problems there.
customer_reviews.author: des-m

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased so far
customer_reviews.text: This panel works well. Accumulates power faster than I thought it would. I'm very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Good to be green and its weight is acceptable
customer_reviews.text: I used this solar panel on last two expedition around Mt. Rainier and it worked very well. During the hikes, all my eletronic devices (cell phone, camera and headlamp) were charged from sun. Good to be green and its weight is acceptable. I think I did a good deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Marcell Kamaras

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Im very happy with this purchase. I felt I got a great deal on it and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Visaya

customer_reviews.title: I own numerous Goal Zero products and they're all excellent. This solar array can charge my Sherpa 100 ...
customer_reviews.text: I own numerous Goal Zero products and they're all excellent. This solar array can charge my Sherpa 100 Power Pack (with inverter accessory). For example, if there's sunlight I can set up the panels, plug into the power pack, then support my MacAir, charge my iPhone and iPad, all at the same time. Charging the Sherpa 100 Power Pack takes all day, but then I can charge a phone or iPad a dozen times each. I have used the panels direct to charge my smart phone and tablet. It takes some time, but when you're 20 miles or more from the road, what's the rush?
customer_reviews.author: Neal Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, took it camping the next day and it kept everything charged even when it was overcast.
customer_reviews.author: Stormm

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I use this everyday in a construction jobsite. always keep my laptop and/or phone charged. combined with my Sherpa 50
customer_reviews.author: Jhonny

customer_reviews.title: First impression is very good. I like the USB female end on the ...
customer_reviews.text: First impression is very good. I like the USB female end on the available cords. I cut off one of the charging ends to put Anderson Power poles on it. Not much actual use or experience with it, but looks like it will charge batteries and smart phones. Ended up buying 3.
customer_reviews.author: KENNETH A NEWCOMB

customer_reviews.title: Better than the rest, right size.
customer_reviews.text: Better Goal Zero Product by far. Not as easy to find as the smaller 7 or 13 Watt models, this one is the same size (tri-fold) as the others. Faster charging. Sadly Goal Zero has gone with proprietary power outputs, but aftermarket options to gended-bend are available. There are cheaper options, but, there are only a few this rugged. Highly recommended. You will want a Battery Unit to partner this with for cloudy/rainy days, Goal Zero Sherpa products are just this.
customer_reviews.author: 7SFCW4

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Solar Panel
customer_reviews.text: Great size panel, very portable. I am charging a Yeti 100 with it currently, but I expect to add another panel of equal or larger size to increase my efficiency. One thing about Goal Zero Products is the attention to quality, having purchased a few different panels from other manufacturers with less than stellar results I was ecstatic with the build quality that Goal Zero provided. This panel is actually my second, I picked up a Nomad 13 in a bundle deal through Costco and fell in love with the company.
customer_reviews.author: Twistedfish

customer_reviews.title: Goal Hero
customer_reviews.text: Pricey no doubt, but the product far exceeds my expectation. I have been able to charge cell phones, iPads, and batteries with no problems. I hope it lasts and works as well as it does now for years to come. Keep up the good work Goal Zero, but don't let the big box outdoor retailers high jack your pricing. You got my attention to become a loyal Goal Zero customer for life, so hopefully your customer service, quality, and future price points keep me in that mindset.
customer_reviews.author: TailwaterTrout

customer_reviews.title: I need another for it to do all the things i would like it to do
customer_reviews.text: used this panel for the first time this weekend. I need another for it to do all the things i would like it to do...but it did run my generator until the sun started coming up for my cpap machine and i had also played music and ran speakers from the generator as well...so it was used for alot of the day and night too...came in very handy...
customer_reviews.author: Theresa West

customer_reviews.title: I have a good amount of solar panels and these are just about ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a good amount of solar panels and these are just about the best. First, it is only a 20w panel, but seems to produce more power than my larger glass panels. Maybe because this can be easily moved. I also think that these are the perfect size for portability. I have a sherpa 100 and it fits right into the zippered pocket. A little expensive, but some of the best quality and usefulness I have experienced.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: perfect for hiking
customer_reviews.text: Hiked Sedona Az. and found this product so light and easy to use. Love the zipper pocket for extras and the many canvas loops easy to attach to my pack. If your looking for solo don't miss this one.
customer_reviews.author: Milton Parrish

customer_reviews.title: good quality, even has a zippered pouch on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well built, good quality, even has a zippered pouch on the back to store your cables.
customer_reviews.author: tmtyioh36

customer_reviews.title: Amazing per usual from this company!
customer_reviews.text: Its goal Zero, what can I say. A company that seems to improve their tech, and then, lower their prices, who does that? I have many pannels, and this is my additional one, to handle my newly purchased Yeti 150. I take Goal Zero with me everywhere. I used them in the filed for ARMY Guard duty, as well as, In the private sector over seas. I have lots of batteries, and pannels. To say Goal Zero to me, is like saying, one uses toilet paper, or baby wipes. Simply, if you do the outdoors, you, do Goal Zero. You know, like, how needed breathing is.
customer_reviews.author: Voltyr LaNier

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: spectacular performance. evenwithout direct sunlight on an overcast day it pulls rabbits out the hat all day strong
customer_reviews.author: duane matlack

customer_reviews.title: did not charge very strongly- may be good for backpacking or something like that but I ended ...
customer_reviews.text: did not charge very strongly- may be good for backpacking or something like that but I ended up getting a standard panel + adaptor for cheaper that charges wayyyyyyyy stronger
customer_reviews.author: george bush

customer_reviews.title: The only panel you'll ever need!
customer_reviews.text: This panel is awesome! Great quality and amazing charge times. Took my iPhone from 0% charge to 100% in just 35 minutes. Remember this was in full Florida sun, which will effect charge times. Also used it while camping to recharge 4 AA batteries with the Nomad battery pack to use in a portable speaker. The batteries charged in 4 hours under slight overcast conditions. Batteries lasted 10 hours in radio. Anything from Goal Zero is a great buy! Slightly more expense then other panels, but worth every penny. Buy the 20 watt panel. It will charge anything. Quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: This is the backbone of my camp energy system. ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the backbone of my camp energy system. I have this hooked to 2 nomad 7's, and it will recharge anything.
customer_reviews.author: sub hunterTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product. It powers a phone with usb like a trickle charger.
customer_reviews.author: Tree

customer_reviews.title: Great idea. HOWEVER
customer_reviews.text: Great idea. HOWEVER. By itself it would not charge my Samsung S4 cell phone. Obviously will now have to buy the power pack to pre-charge instead. And wouldn't have a green light for charging unless it was in bright-direct sun. No clouds or it won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa S.

customer_reviews.title: This handy folding 20W solar collector appears to be a ...
customer_reviews.text: This handy folding 20W solar collector appears to be a very efficient small solar collector. Bear in mind, of course, that the Goal Zero brand is proprietary and it will be most convenient when used with other Goal Zero products.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. Jeter

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works, but doesn't generate enough power to recharge my Yeti 400.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin Fisk

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to charge my iPhone, and it works perfectly. It seems to charge about 1%/min. The Nomad 7W will not charge an iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Toler

customer_reviews.title: Work well for transporting
customer_reviews.text: Slow to recharge battery, but work as described and are light weight and easy to transport.
customer_reviews.author: JenRog

customer_reviews.title: Requires Direct Sun
customer_reviews.text: It is not a bad solar panel but it fails when it's cloudy out to charge my goal zero. I have already written a simalar reveiw with suggestions to Goal Zero but never got a response.
customer_reviews.author: Pain-N-Neck

customer_reviews.title: What a Great Solar Panel !
customer_reviews.text: The Goal Zero Nomad 20 charges up the Guide 10 plus in no time flat! What an awesome solar panel !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Larry7

customer_reviews.title: it's awesome
customer_reviews.text: study built! lots of connector no direct output for laptop
customer_reviews.author: Archangels

customer_reviews.title: ... into my gadgets without Sherpa 100 and it works great even in cloudy days
customer_reviews.text: im using it directly into my gadgets without Sherpa 100 and it works great even in cloudy days. I wish you could remove the permanent cables that you don't use as they are just loosely folded away in a compartment it would reduce size slightly anyway I am very happy with it and it charged my tablet in sunlight in about 6 hours
customer_reviews.author: Dean Mason

customer_reviews.title: Great panel for basecamp
customer_reviews.text: The Nomad 20 paired with my Sherpa 50 held up well. It was rained on a couple hours each day but this panel charged the Sherpa each day to a full charge after about 5 hours of sun or so. It is a little heavy to be backpacking with on a regular basis but if you weren't concerned about weight then this thing would be fine. It comes with three cables attached. One for charging some sort of storage device like my Sherpa 50, one for charging a USB device, and one for chaining together other solar panels to increase the output.
customer_reviews.author: thesphynx

customer_reviews.title: It took 2-3 days to load the battery just fine. Then we finally needed it a month ago ...
customer_reviews.text: We got this with the Yeti 150 battery/power pack. It was verified to work and used a couple of times. It took 2-3 days to load the battery just fine. Then we finally needed it a month ago (our wall charger was damaged), and it worked. A couple of weeks later, when I tried again, nothing. Yeti does not charge, nor do any of the power outputs I tried (USB, 12v) with different devices. So my Yeti is drained, and can't charge it, and my overpriced portable panel broke after 4 -5 uses. It looks very well made. Aparently, it isn't.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Silva

customer_reviews.title: It's nice that it folds up for storage
customer_reviews.text: It works, but save your money and buy a different panel. Just make sure you buy the adapter to go with it. I purchased a 30W panel from Renogy and the adapter and still didn't spend $70.00. It's nice that it folds up for storage, but at that cost it's not that great of a feature.
customer_reviews.author: LaurieR

customer_reviews.title: Lacking Information
customer_reviews.text: It was not sufficient for my needs. No indication whether it was adequate for the Yeti 400 that I also purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Eastman

customer_reviews.title: Crap. It doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Crap. It doesn't work. The recharger only got to 2 of 4 bars - even after days of sunlight and no usage!!
customer_reviews.author: Jm

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I never received the solar panel .. just the generator
customer_reviews.author: sydney Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to pair it with our Goal Zero Yeti 150. Used them both on a 4-day camping trip. Kept our phones and iPad charged and lights all evening. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: got alittle over 20 watts out of it in the ...
customer_reviews.text: got alittle over 20 watts out of it in the full sun, so I would say it works as expected
customer_reviews.author: GotAFarmYetTop Contributor: Camping

product_meta.title: Goal Zero Nomad 20 Solar Panel
product_meta.description: Size:One Size| Color:One ColorThe Nomad 20 Solar Panel combines highly efficient mono-crystalline technology in a foldable, portable, plug-and-play form. With a built-in junction box and innovative smart chip, the Nomad 20 can directly charge handheld USB and 12 Volt devices directly from the sun, just as fast as the wall. Combine the Nomad 20 Solar Panel with any of Goal Zero's power packs and store power to charge your gear day or night. Ports-USB Port (output): 5V, up to 2A (10W max), regulated ; Solar Port (blue, 8mm): 14-22V, up to 1.3A (20W max) ; Mini Solar Port (2.5mm): 6.5V, up to 1.1A (7W max), regulated
feature_bullets: Built-in junction box with smart-charging chip, allows you to power handheld USB and 12 Volt gear from the sun
Patented chaining technology combines Goal Zero Nomad panels for faster charge times
Highly efficient mono-crystalline solar pumps out more power per square inch. Optimal Operating Temp: 0-120 F (-17-48 C)
Pair with any Goal Zero power pack (sold separately) and charge gear day or night
Foldable and portable for use anywhere

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars166 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
